title: CryptoKids, America's Future Codemakers & Codebreakers
content:
Introducing the Crypto Cat and Decipher Dog.
[img]http://www.nsa.gov/kids/bios/images/BioShot_CC_html.gif[/img] [img]http://www.nsa.gov/kids/bios/images/BioShot_DD_html.gif[/img]

There are the others (Rosetta Stone, T. Top, Joules, Slate, and CSS Sam) too, but I'm too lazy to introduce them.

Crypto Cat is well known for inventing ciphers whereas D-Dog is good at breaking them.


You can also learn about the National Security Agency/Central Security Service - theyre Americas real codemakers and codebreakers. Our Nations leaders and warfighters count on the technology and information they get from NSA/CSS to get their jobs done. Without NSA/CSS, they wouldnt be able to talk to one another without the bad guys listening and they wouldnt be able to figure out what the bad guys were planning.

We hope you have lots of fun learning about cryptology and NSA/CSS. You might be part of the next generation of Americas codemakers and codebreakers.

[url=http://www.nsa.gov/kids/]www.nsa.gov/kids/[/url]


[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Ah, propaganda-like stuff..Eat your veggies!

title: Re: CryptoKids, America's Future Codemakers & Codebreak
content:
Cool, nice find! Bravo for KeenRush! Marvelous of you![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

I really like this site. It has all kinds of cool stuff![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] Even morse code! (which is hard to remember) It just doesn't have SGA...[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] (not only is SGA hard to remember, but throwing it on that site without copyright notice would be copyright infringement.)

I found a website where the morse code is. I have just printed out the morse code from [url=http://www.babbage.demon.co.uk/morseabc.html]this website[/url].

I'm glad you found that website though- it's much more fun than that site I listed. (insert infinite [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] s here)

Nice find! *gives Keen Rush a pat on the back*Signed, Harvey Smith
A proud member of the beta testing society
"I help entertain!" -Harvey
Tough guys have no table manners![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img]

title: Furries make anything relatable to kids.

content:

title: Re: Furries make anything relatable to kids.
content:
Hey; they have fur right? They're furries. If you don't believe me go to the 'encrypting naughty pictures' section.

Teaching kids to code, since when have they needed encouragement? Ever heard of bootling? Cats elbow? Oppish? All invented by children.

And I think the bad guys in this case are not only those blasted commies and towelheads, but also those sunglasses wearing CIA spooks. Never can trust those bastards, just as you set up a kiddy porn ring they step right in and nab you. Why if I didn't look so cute and innocnet...


A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society
